data.prompt:
Extract comprehensive customer insights from reviews about Three Way Multi-Location Control Switches.
The output format is JSON in English:
{
"phy": {
"<PHYSICAL>": {
"<PID>@<DETAIL>": {
"<SENT>": [ID, …]
}
}
},
"perf": {
"<PERF>": {
"<perf_id>@<DETAIL>": {
"<SENT>": {<PERF_REASON>: [ID, …]}
}
}
},
"use": {
"<USE>": {
"<SENT>": {<USE_REASON>: [ID, …]}
}
}
}

Definitions:
- <PID>: Unique ID for physical aspect ("phy"), starting from A. After Z, continue with AA, AB, and so on.
- <PHYSICAL>: Components or inherent physical properties of the Three Way Multi-Location Control Switches without external interaction (e.g. dimensions, appearance, material type...)
- <DETAIL>: A self-contained detail summarized from the reviews.
- <SENT>: Sentiment polarity of the current <DETAIL> (- for negative, + for positive).
- ID: All review IDs mentioning the <DETAIL>
- <perf_id>: Unique ID for performance or functions ("perf"), starting from a. After z, continue with aa, ab, and so on.
- <PERF>: The Three Way Multi-Location Control Switches' performance (e.g. flexibility, durability, ...) or behaviors under various conditions (e.g. temperature, force, chemicals...) without reference to any specific use case
- <PERF_REASON>: <PID> of the <PHYSICAL> explicitly mentioned as the cause of the <PERF>. Include all mentioned <PID>s. If no reason is mentioned, use "?". <PERF_REASON> and <PERF> should have the same sentiment polarity in the review where they are mentioned together (i.e. the same review ID are included at both locations)
- <USE>: The specific application, applicable object, method, tool, or environment for the product.
- <USE_REASON>: <perf_id> or <PID> causing the <USE>'s sentiment. Include all mentioned reasons, or "?" if none can be inferred. <USE_REASON> and <USE> should have the same sentiment polarity in the review where they are mentioned together.

CRITICAL INSTRUCTIONS:
- <PHYSICAL>/<PERF> and <DETAIL> MUST NOT include:
  * Generic statements without details (e.g., "good", "bad quality")
  * Issues unrelated to the product itself (e.g., "fast shipping", "delivery time")
- If a review mentions any physical aspect, related performance, or use together, extract them as separate entries under "phy," "perf," and "use," with no overlap.
- Make sure each <DETAIL> is under the most relevant <PHYSICAL> or <PERF> in the context of Three Way Multi-Location Control Switches
- Preserve negations

Key Instructions:
- Break down reviews with multiple aspects, performances, or uses into individual entries.
- Escape special characters with backslash that could cause JSON syntax errors.
- Include only explicitly mentioned reasons, and use "?" where no reason is mentioned.

Final Checklist:
- Go through all reviews and ensure that no aspect, performance, use, or reason is omitted, even if only mentioned once.
- Review all entries to ensure proper separation between aspects, performances, and uses.

Print the JSON result only.
Input format:
<ID>#<review>

[[INPUT]]
0#Light switches. When we did construction in our new home, the electrician put another brand of switches in and said they were fine. I have to disagree with him so I bought this brand and I’m so happy I did my lights don’t flicker. I have some switches on dimmers some without from now on I will never use another light switch besides this brand.
1#Cheap material. Weak materials. Broke more than installed.
2#Poor quality. Brand new out of the box . It kept shorting out defective. Has to run to Lowes to buy switch to complete install. Didn't bother to try to return it. Will never by this brand again
3#Works Well. Easy to install and looks nice. To me it looks very modern. It's definitely an upgrade to our home. Installs like any other switch. I did run out and get different caps because I felt the ones this came with weren't adequate, however that's just me being technical. They are your typical everyday caps that are in every home. Dims well and has a small light bar on the side that looks slick. Zero noise when turning it on and it truly feels well built. Fits a little snug compared to other switches but you'll just need to menuver it to the plate. I put it in a four plate outlet and did just fine.
4#Love ghey way these feel. Much more definitive "click" then other brands. Just feel like more of a luxury switch.
5#Works as expected. Does what we need it to do for our mudroom. We love the lutron lights.
6#Worth the extra $. My husband is an electrician and asks for these only in our home. I like the way it says "Lutron" very tiny on it. Don't waste time and $ on the cheap ones.
7#I really like the look thise switched give you. Good looking switch that does a great job.
8#Clean Look. The switch is a nice clean look after adding the Lutron cover, which is sold seperately. The screws are not exposed.
9#Matches up with Lutron Diva Dimmers. I like the higher end look when using with diva dimmers and lutron screwless plates.
10#Love the look. It’s good quality product, easy to install and beautiful design
11#Good switch. After an interior facelift on our dining room we decided to upgrade the switches and outlets. This switch installed easily and works as described.
12#Stopped working. 2 months into using these, 3 out of 7 stopped working. Had my electrician come check it out in case he did something wrong, but it's the switch. These are too expensive for them to stop working so quickly.
13#Paid for new, received used. I received a used unit when I paid for a new one. Packaging was damaged and parts outside of packaging.
14#Expensive! The Claro switch by Lutron is far more expensive than the comparable Leviton switch. If it weren’t for uniformity, I would not have bought it. Also, the wire plug in terminal on the back of the switch would not accept a regular sized wired.
15#Performs exactly as expected. Great simple replacement switch. A little cheap to not come with a face plate, otherwise great.
16#Upgraded light switch! These were extremely easy to install, I swapped out traditional light switches. Now I want to switch them all out! I love the clean and modern look!
17#Best. Beautiful design, great quality switch, easy to install
18#Loud! Very loud. On the lest side is regular and on their right side is Lutron. You can tell it is Way more loud. Other wise is good. I will replace it.
19#Solid Rocker. Good switch. Got a couple of these to add to a 3 switch layout. My Garage lights are on a schedule with a Caseta but didn’t need it for the other two switches so I got two of these to fill in the layout . They work well, solid clicks
20#Good value for the price. Arrived quickly and good price
21#Nice basic switch. Nice basic switch.
22#Clunky but dors the job. Decent price for matching looks with other Lutron controls. But it feels clunky with a distinct snapping sound, not the soft click and light touch of some other rocker switches.
23#Dimming is great! Like this product great to be less dirupptive to people sleeping in close proximity when you have different schedules.
24#Worth it... you get what you pay for. Re-outfitted my entire home with Lutron outlets, switches, and faceplates. You can really tell the difference in quality between Lutron and other brands. They might be more expensive, but the solid feel and quality of materials makes them totally worth it.
25#Easy to Install, Look Great, but Switch Use Direction is Weird. These are easy to install and look great as I get my home ready to sell. The only thing is the direction of the how you use the switch is weird to me. To turn the light on, you push in the bottom of the switch - meaning when the lights are on the top of the toggle is sticking out. This may just be a user preference, but I would prefer to hit the top of the toggle to turn the light on as it makes more sense to me. This can be remedied by removing the toggle plate and switching the position, but then the Lutron logo is upside down. As other reviewers said, the switch makes a nice click when it turns on/off and I like that. One other thing to mention is that my switch boxes are pretty small and full of wires bc this is an old house, so it was difficult for me to make everything fit but that's just unique to my house.
26#Love Lutron Switches. I am replacing all the switches in my home with rockers, and these were priced well and worked great. Love 'em.
27#Best switches. Can't go wrong with a basic Lutron switch. Much nicer to use than standard flip switches and looks more executive even at home.
28#Great quality but costs more. Great quality but costs more. Better construction than competing brands. Lutron has various colors and sells outlets & dimmers too so you can use one brand throughout the house.
29#Cracked within the year. These didn't last a year. They cracked and needed to be replaced.
30#Lutron is the best. I always use Lutron products. These switches have a positive click on and off and last way longer than others.
31#This product looks good and was easy to install. This product is easy to install and looks good and is durable
32#Snapped in half while installing. I have installed Leviton switches throughout my house but I figured for my family room I would install the Lutron as they seem nicer (to me at least). While installing the 3-way, I was tightening the screw on the hot wire and the switch snapped in half (the black housing in the back) rendering the switch useless. I have replaced all the switches in my house and not once did I run into this issue with any of the other Lutron or Leviton switches. With that being said, I will be sticking with Leviton. Lutron, while looking and feeling nicer than Leviton seems more fragile.
33#Matches great. We needed a variety of styles (4 ways, on/off, dimmers) for our kitchen/hallway and lutron provided the rocker style in all of them and all were matching white (it's amazing how white varies between manufactures). We have all lutron switches in the kitchen and hallway and will slowly replace all our others- easy to install and works great.
34#Defective product, poor quality. I bought 2 of these switches. I spent 2 hours trouble shooting my wiring after installation because I couldn’t get the lights to turn on properly. When the wiring kept checking out I finally started trouble shooting the switches with a meter and one of the positions was open and it would never work. The other switch’s body fell apart after I rewired it a couple of times when I was troubleshooting. Would never by these again.
35#Lutron is one of the best. Bought a bunch of these lutron switches, good quality
36#Beautiful clean look. Beautiful clean switches. And with the correct snap on plates, there are no visible screws or attachments. Perfect for a modern house
37#Click-bate in a good way. This is the one - spendy but that click is the most satisfying of all the clicks. Verges on orgasmic really, so be prepared and aware. Again, the plastic is really nice.
38#Good but kinda weak. They look good next to my smart switches, used them on the other ends of my 3 way smart switches. One of the three I ordered snapped apart in my hand on install though so kind of disappointed there. Otherwise, they look and operate good. Will be ordering more.
39#Great Product. Easy and simple to install.
40#Nice switch. At a glance it looks no different than most other switches but definitely feels more sturdy to the touch. I replaced my Levitons with these and am much happier with the feel and sound it makes when you turn it off or on.
41#Great product: Works as expected! No surprises! Works as expected !
42#WARNING: “Common” Terminal isn’t in the “common” place. I am wiring our new “CAT5 cottage” on the Texas Gulf Coast using Lutron dimmers and switches, just like we have in our house in Houston. Lutron makes high quality switchgear, but like a lot of electrical stuff, the documentation is dumbed-down severely. Today I spend over an hour trying to make a 3-way circuit work using this switch with a Lutron dimmer at the other end. Turns-out that Lutron doesn’t put the “common” terminal in the same place as everybody else (alone, at one end of the switch), AND my switches DID NOT HAVE a different colored screw for common (all screws were brass colored). Apparently they ran-out of black screws at the factory in Korea. And (as noted in one of the QUESTIONS, the “common” is not marked on the body of the switch anywhere. The Lutron “common” terminal is (a) on the END with two terminals, AND (b) on the SIDE with two terminals. Once I figured that out (from the wiring diagram, NOT the installation instruction) it worked great.
43#Love these switches. Love these switches.
44#Awesome. Exactly what I ordered, great price.
45#Fragile. Literally disintegrated in my hands upon install. Cheapest plastic ever. I have installed smart Lutron wifi switches. They have been solid. Either this product is fake or pure weak sauce.
46#a switch. It's a switch. Thank you. -- Ahmed, age 5 and 3/4 (and dada)
47#Missing parts. Bought from Amazon and it was missing all of the screws. Dint know if Lutron forgot include them, or if this was returned from another customer and not fully checked.
